step.context: \text{If } \dfrac{2 x}{x^2 + 3x +2} = \dfrac{A}{P(x)} + \dfrac{B}{x+2}, \\ \text{then, what are A, B and P(x)?}
step.reason: \dfrac{2 x}{x^2 + 3x +2} = \dfrac{2x}{(x+1)(x+2)} = \dfrac{A}{x+1} + \dfrac{B}{x+2} \\ \implies P(x) = x+1 \\ \begin{align} \text{Moreover, } 2x &= A(x+2) + B(x+1)\\ &= (A+B)x + (2A+B) \end{align} \\ \implies A + B =2 \text{ and } 2A +B = 0. \\ \text{Solve to get } A =-2 \text{ and } B = 4
\text{Using the result of step (1) }, \\ \dfrac{2 x}{x^2 + 3x +2} = \dfrac{-2}{x+1} + \dfrac{4}{x+2}\\ \text{So, simply apply } \\ a \int \dfrac{dx}{x} = a \log |x| + C = \log|x^a| + C
